textContent:
Sieges would occur based on when the two guilds agree upon. 
Each of them would pick a time and the average between the two would be the time of the siege (1 hour bracket). 
They both have an incentive to pick their most advantageous time, but if they both do that then none of them will get the most advantageous outcome. Instead, they will try to undershoot/overshoot so that the average is moved in their favor. But if they both do that, then they end up in the same place.

In the end, the only thing that would prevent this all is an actual agreement, a Treaty. Players
